content: Valparaíso is a beautiful and unique port city with many hills and narrow streets that can make driving and parking a bit challenging. I would recommend relying on public transportation, which is cheap and frequent. Valparaíso has an excellent bus system with multiple routes that can take you to all parts of the city, as well as a funicular that runs between the top and bottom of the hills. You can purchase a MetroCard or Bip! card at any metro station or at some convenience stores, which you can reload whenever needed. Taxis and Ubers are available, but the rates can be higher than public transportation, especially during rush hours or on weekends. However, if you prefer to have more freedom and explore outside of the city, renting a car can be an option, but keep in mind that parking is limited and driving can be challenging due to the steep hills and narrow roads. Overall, I would recommend using public transportation for getting around Valparaíso and saving your rental car for exploring the wider region, depending on your travel plans.
